N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 177.9 - Access to records

State Regulations
(a) In the
conduct of his/her duties pursuant to these regulations, the ombudsman shall
have access to all books, records, logs, reports, memoranda and any and all
other materials or written documents in the possession of the division, its
facilities or programs. The ombudsman may copy or make reference to any such
report, document, memorandum, log entry or other material or written document
and, where appropriate, may include a copy in his/her report. Consistent with
applicable laws and regulations, the confidentiality of records and documents
obtained by the ombudsmen shall be maintained by them. (b) The facility or program director shall
promptly forward to the facility ombudsman copies of all written reports
concerning the use of room confinement, psychotropic medication and mechanical
restraints. (See section
168.2
[j]
of this

Title.)
